result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Vanhoosen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs = $443 minus $150 cash bond posted= $293  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 10/30/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 4 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

The Court orders Mr. VanHoosen to submit a DNA sample to Sheriff's Department prior to release

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D Vanhoosen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Bond posted at Watertown PD
Time to Pay / Payment Extension Reminder

Case called at 8:35am [mo]
Defendant Anthony D Vanhoosen in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

[Hearing on Failure to Appear at FSSC]

The Court finds that Mr. Vanhoosen has satisfied the warrant and it should be removed from any database.

Mr. VanHoosen indicates that he understood that he would have a plea/sentencing date due to his acceptance of the State's offer; VanHoosen indicates that due to his acceptance of the offer, he understood the FSSC and Jury Trial would be removed from the Court's calendar. 

The Court modifies Mr. VanHoosen's bond to $500 CASH, with the same non-monetary conditions
The Court notifies Mr. VanHoosen that it will call his case when the Court has availability in its schedule. 
recess: 8:39am--reconvene:9:46am [to allow the Court to call other cases]

Defendant Anthony D Vanhoosen in court, in custody. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews Mr. VanHoosen's right to Counsel. The Court finds that Mr. VanHoosen is competent to represent himself. The Court finds the Mr. VanHoosen is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel. 

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses the 'Domestic Violence' enhancer

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs = $443 minus $150 cash bond posted= $293  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 10/30/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 4 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. VanHoosen to submit a DNA sample to Sheriff's Department prior to release
recess: 10:11am
Mr. Vanhoosen is to be brought before Judge Wambach upon being taken into custody.

Case called at 3:36pm [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Anthony D Vanhoosen does NOT appear.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court reviews the Court Record. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint.
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only. 
Mr. Vanhoosen is to be brought before Judge Wambach upon being taken into custody. 
The Court orders bond to be in default and to forfeited.
recess: 3:42pm
DA Routing Slip requesting Plea and Sentencing be scheduled
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
made by Defendant VanHoosen on this date

[MK] case called at 11:06am.
Defendant Anthony D Vanhoosen in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial is requested by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 Cash Bond ($500 cash was already posted, of this $350 is to be refunded), with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person
-no discussion of the facts of the case with Amanda Gilmer
recess 11:10am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 3:40pm.  (2) FSSC on 10/5/15 at 3:00pm.--JA please note in comments that speedy trial time limits pend (3) Jury Trial on  10/8/15 at 8:30am
